name: Espire Clothing
overview: Espire Clothing is an Australian made apparel label offering customisable basics. The brand markets ethical production, local supply partners, and a circular design model. Products are developed around Melbourne fabrics and locally stitched in Bright and Mansfield, Victoria.
practices: Circular 'seed to store' framing with zero waste off-cut line ('The Bad Batch').
Traceability through references to Melbourne fabrics, Bendigo wool, Belgian linen, and Good Earth Cotton.
On-shore manufacturing and partnerships with local suppliers.
Product-level sustainability statements rather than formal reports.
sdgs: SDG 8 – Decent Work and Economic Growth

diversity.workplace_equality: Acknowledges Traditional Custodians of land; fair work focus
diversity.inclusion_policy: Circular and ethical language without a formal inclusion policy

corporate_governance.description: Privately owned Australian fashion business focusing on ethical and circular production. No formal governance data disclosed.

involvement.Environmental Harm: Low risk due to on-shore small batch production
involvement.Supply Chain Transparency: Moderate – qualitative traceability without published supplier map

concerns: No sustainability report or measurable KPIs available.
Traceability statements are qualitative and not third-party verified.
Circularity and transparency claims lack quantitative data.
